alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 07 at 6:40PM EDT until September 07 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.7 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Franklin Park, Shaler Township, Hampton Township, Wexford, West View, Gibsonia, Curtisville and Pine Township. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
